comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://fishwrangler.com/my](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffishwrangler.com%2Fmy) ### Comment > The left and right sidebars offering a speed boost if the adblocker is disabled used to be blocked until a couple of days ago. Now, even if I block the elements, if I refresh, they come back again. I had 4 or 5 user rules that I had added in the hopes of getting rid of them until I decided to report it. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
It seems that it's caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist`, so please add this rule:
```adblock
iadfrance.fr#@##scroll-to-top:not(html):not(body)
```
to user rules.

EasyList is not required since you have Base filter enabled.

By the way, I think that some of these rules for apps still work correctly, I mean those:
```adblock
||static.ylilauta.org/js/*/Module/FrameLoader.js$replace=/this\.#?contentLoadFailed\(\);//
||ylilauta.org^$document,replace=/(<script src="https:\/\/static\.ylilauta\.org\/js\/.+?\/Module\/FrameLoader\.js" )integrity=".*?" (type="module"><\/script>)/\$1\$2/
||ylilauta.org^$removeheader=link
```
so maybe it would be a good idea to re-add them?

comment.body:
`trusted-set-cookie-reload` doesn't work on my end, probably due to `encodeURIComponent` used here - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/blob/85e6beb995ad415d5dbe8574abd39230e8b1d5ee/src/helpers/cookie-utils.js#L35-L37
but I'm not sure.

I have added:
```adblock
agoda.com##section[class^="TallBanner__container-"]
agoda.com#%#(function(){if(-1==document.cookie.indexOf("agoda.banner")){const a=new Date,b=a.getTime(),c=new Date(b+1314000000);document.cookie=`agoda.banner=OverlayBanner - Promo=1; path=/; expires=${c.toUTCString()}`,location.reload()}})();
```
<hr>

>OTOH I don't see ##.ConsentBanner so maybe geo-dependent?

Yes, it probably depends on location.

comment.body:
I wonder if we could fix it without unblocking this script.
It seems that something like this:
```adblock
9to5google.com,9to5mac.com,9to5toys.com,dronedj.com,electrek.co#%#AG_onLoad(function(){document.documentElement.appendChild(document.createElement('div'));});
```
works fine on my end.

I have checked it with:
```adblock
@@||cdn.viglink.com/api/vglnk.js$domain=9to5google.com|9to5mac.com|9to5toys.com|dronedj.com|electrek.co,badfilter
```

comment.body:
It has been a couple of days since the first computer started being detected. 
Now the issue has escalated to 4 windows 11 Home machines on the same network. So-far the windows 11 Pro box has not been detected and has no issues on the site. My 2 Android phones have not had any issues. 

The Annoyance Filter: ON or OFF does NOT change anything. Adding and removing other filters and creating some on my own has not changed anything.

While removing and reinstalling adguard I found pihole will block the ads and not be detected by the site.
Reinstalling adguard and disabling pihole, The windows machines will be detected and are blocked by the banner. 

It looks to me, The Weather Channel has found a way to detect Adguard for windows.

Here when you searched for `adguard` in Japanese:
